Articles.Content:
These parts are designed to give your ship a infinite fuel source.

Utilizing Electro-magnetism, these scoops pull fuel from the empty space between planetary bodies.

There will be four ramscoops you can put on your ship;

Radial ramscoop

1.25 ramscoop

2.5 ramscoop

2.5 "retro" fixed ramscoop

Edited August 24, 2013 by Slye_Fox
You export straight from Unity now, I think, a lot of those tutorials seem rather out of date - caveat, I've only exported a box. Unity seems to accept whatever you like to give it as source.
What's Unity?

Unity is Unity http://unity3d.com/unity/download/

You'll also want to grab PartTools http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/34013-0-20-PartTools-GameDatabase-and-new-features

Make the models in whatever you want, port them into a format Unity can handle (Most formats), set up the transforms and hierarchy in Unity, export to .mu, load into KSP

Thanks.

Quick question; how many sides are usually on the cylinders?
18-24 sides
Depends on the diameter. I believe a standard 1.25m rocket bell uses 16 in KSP. Sketchup circles default to 24 so that's what I go with. Anything really in that range is more than appropriate.
After lots of fiddling about and scrounging through threads to figure out how to get Unity to work, this is the result of my first KSP model;
Is that the ram scoop from Red Dwarf?
Yes, indeed it is.

is that the ram scoop from red dwarf?

omg omg omg
Decided to remake it basing it more on the series X prop;

Please please PLEASE tell me it works!

Or, can it at least fold out?
I always want to say something along the lines of "Hmm, what does that remind me of?" and then someone goes and points it out. ;n;

Please please PLEASE tell me it works!

Or, can it at least fold out?

It doesn't work yet, the coding needs a bit more work.

And this particular part is fixed, as in unanimated.

STILL- EPIC!

Truly epic!

If anyone wants to help, here's the code I got so far;


    MODULE
    {
        name = ModuleResourceIntake
        resourceName = Kethane
        checkForOxygen = true
        area = -0.01
        intakeSpeed = 1
        intakeTransformName = intake
    }

    RESOURCE
    {
        name = Kethane
        amount = 0.02
        maxAmount = 0.02
    }

I took a air-intake as a basis for the code.

The main thing I need a hand with is inverting the atmosphere need, as in making it so this only works when out of the atmosphere.

I went back and remade the diffuse texture on the scoop.

But before I'm done, I need some info;

How do I make light maps (as in parts of a texture that's lit up).

What kind of bump mapping does KSP use?

Note an real ramscope would scale with speed, as faster you travel who more you could collect, yes this would change with SOI of planets and moons but I guess you would find more ions closer to planets, however some moons would actually reduce your speed, so using this to intercept Gilly might be an challenge and you would need stored fuel.

It would also require plenty of power.

Just to make it more realistic and more challenging.

Note an real ramscope would scale with speed, as faster you travel who more you could collect, yes this would change with SOI of planets and moons but I guess you would find more ions closer to planets, however some moons would actually reduce your speed, so using this to intercept Gilly might be an challenge and you would need stored fuel.

It would also require plenty of power.

Just to make it more realistic and more challenging.

Er... didn't quite get that first part.
It means, the faster you move, the more ions fly by you.
Still need that help with the code.
